head.title: Metro Briefing | New Jersey: Elizabeth: Police Announce Gang Arrests

hedline.hl1: Metro Briefing | New Jersey: Elizabeth: Police Announce Gang Arrests

body.head.byline: By JOHN HOLL; Compiled by John Sullivan

abstract.p: Seventeen people said to be members of Plainfield, NJ, street gang are arrested on racketeering, weapons and drug charges (S)

block.p: Seventeen people said to be members of a Plainfield street gang have been arrested and charged with offenses including racketeering, weapons possession and drug charges, Union County officials said yesterday. Early Monday morning, agents with the Union County prosecutor's office and state troopers raided 19 sites in Plainfield, Piscataway and Scotch Plains, the prosecutor, Theodore J. Romankow, said. The gang, known as the Clinton Avenue Posse, was responsible for street violence and drug dealing in the Plainfield area, Mr. Romankow said. Officials said that the police seized nine guns along with heroin and cocaine during the raids.

Officials said that the police seized nine guns along with heroin and cocaine during the raids.
